intro: Erigeron lancifolius var. lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are typically pale blue to white in color. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
